entities.name: queen's knight captures pawn on d5
king's knight captures knight on d5

relations.subject: player-white
relations.context: White opens with the queen's pawn, moving it two squares forward to the d4 square.

relations.subject: piece-w-qpawn
relations.context: moving it two squares forward to the d4 square.

relations.subject: key_move-1
relations.context: A classic, solid start, aiming to control the center of the board.

relations.subject: player-black
relations.context: Black immediately challenges that central control, developing the king's knight to f6.

relations.subject: piece-b-kknight
relations.context: developing the king's knight to f6.

relations.subject: key_move-2
relations.context: Black immediately challenges that central control.

relations.subject: player-white
relations.context: White develops the queen's knight to c3.

relations.subject: piece-w-qknight
relations.context: develops the queen's knight to c3.

relations.subject: piece-w-qknight
relations.context: preparing to support the d4 pawn.

relations.subject: player-black
relations.context: Black mirrors White's pawn move, pushing the d-pawn to d5.

relations.subject: piece-b-dpawn
relations.context: pushing the d-pawn to d5.

relations.subject: player-white
relations.context: White plays the g-pawn to g3.

relations.subject: piece-w-gpawn
relations.context: plays the g-pawn to g3.

relations.subject: key_move-5
relations.context: This signals an intention to place the king's bishop on the long diagonal, a setup known as a fianchetto.

relations.subject: player-black
relations.context: Black moves the King to d7. This is incredibly unusual.

relations.subject: piece-b-king
relations.context: moves the King to d7.

relations.subject: key_move-6
relations.context: This is a massive strategic risk, placing the monarch in a potentially vulnerable position.

relations.subject: player-white
relations.context: White calmly proceeds with the plan, placing the king's bishop on the g2 square.

relations.subject: piece-w-kbishop
relations.context: placing the king's bishop on the g2 square.

relations.subject: player-black
relations.context: Black bolsters the center by moving the c-pawn to c6.

relations.subject: piece-b-cpawn
relations.context: moving the c-pawn to c6.

relations.subject: piece-b-cpawn
relations.context: A solid move to support the d5 pawn.

relations.subject: player-white
relations.context: White raises the stakes, pushing the e-pawn to e4.

relations.subject: piece-w-epawn
relations.context: pushing the e-pawn to e4.

relations.subject: player-black
relations.context: Black develops the queen's knight to a6.

relations.subject: piece-b-qknight
relations.context: develops the queen's knight to a6.

relations.subject: player-white
relations.context: The first capture! White's e-pawn captures Black's pawn on d5.

relations.subject: piece-w-epawn
relations.context: White's e-pawn captures Black's pawn on d5.

relations.subject: player-black
relations.context: Black immediately recaptures, taking the pawn on d5 with the c-pawn.

relations.subject: piece-b-cpawn
relations.context: taking the pawn on d5 with the c-pawn.

relations.subject: player-white
relations.context: White continues the exchanges, capturing the pawn on d5 with the queen's knight.

relations.subject: piece-w-qknight
relations.context: capturing the pawn on d5 with the queen's knight.

relations.subject: player-black
relations.context: Black is happy to trade, capturing the knight on d5 with the king's knight.

relations.subject: piece-b-kknight
relations.context: capturing the knight on d5 with the king's knight.

relations.subject: player-white
relations.context: And White completes the sequence of captures, taking the knight on d5 with the powerful bishop from g2.

relations.subject: piece-w-kbishop
relations.context: taking the knight on d5 with the powerful bishop from g2.

relations.subject: player-black
relations.context: Black pushes the e-pawn to e6.

relations.subject: piece-b-epawn
relations.context: pushes the e-pawn to e6.

relations.subject: key_move-16
relations.context: restricting the scope of that powerful white bishop.

relations.subject: player-white
relations.context: White brings out the most powerful piece, the Queen, moving it to g4.

relations.subject: piece-w-queen
relations.context: moving it to g4.

relations.subject: player-black
relations.context: Black responds by moving the Queen to c7.

relations.subject: piece-b-queen
relations.context: moving the Queen to c7.

relations.subject: player-white
relations.context: White develops the king's knight to f3.

relations.subject: piece-w-kknight
relations.context: develops the king's knight to f3.

relations.subject: player-black
relations.context: Black's king's bishop jumps to b4, delivering a check to the white king.

relations.subject: key_move-20
relations.context: delivering a check to the white king.

relations.subject: player-white
relations.context: White blocks the check by moving the c-pawn to c3.

relations.subject: key_move-21
relations.context: White blocks the check.

relations.subject: player-black
relations.context: Black captures the pawn on c3 with the bishop, delivering another check!

relations.subject: piece-b-kbishop
relations.context: captures the pawn on c3 with the bishop.

relations.subject: key_move-22
relations.context: delivering another check!

relations.subject: player-white
relations.context: White recaptures the bishop with the b-pawn.

relations.subject: piece-w-bpawn
relations.context: recaptures the bishop with the b-pawn.

relations.subject: player-black
relations.context: And Black's Queen swoops in to capture the pawn on c3, delivering a third consecutive check.

relations.subject: piece-b-queen
relations.context: Queen swoops in to capture the pawn on c3.

relations.subject: key_move-24
relations.context: delivering a third consecutive check.

relations.subject: player-white
relations.context: The white King is forced to move, stepping up to e2.

relations.subject: piece-w-king
relations.context: stepping up to e2.

relations.subject: player-black
relations.context: The Queen dives all the way to a1 to capture White's rook.

relations.subject: piece-b-queen
relations.context: captures White's rook.

relations.subject: player-white
relations.context: White immediately punishes this, leaping the knight to e5 with a check!

relations.subject: key_move-27
relations.context: leaping the knight to e5 with a check!

relations.subject: key_move-27
relations.context: The attack begins!

relations.subject: player-black
relations.context: The black King is forced to run, moving to c7.

relations.subject: piece-b-king
relations.context: moving to c7.

relations.subject: player-white
relations.context: White's Queen joins the attack, capturing the g-pawn.

relations.subject: player-black
relations.context: Black's Queen begins the long journey back, capturing a pawn on d4.

relations.subject: player-white
relations.context: Another check! White's Queen captures the f-pawn.

relations.subject: key_move-31
relations.context: Another check!

relations.subject: player-black
relations.context: The king is forced to flee again, this time to b6.

relations.subject: piece-b-king
relations.context: this time to b6.

relations.subject: player-white
relations.context: It hops to c4, delivering another check.

relations.subject: key_move-33
relations.context: delivering another check.

relations.subject: player-black
relations.context: The king's journey continues to b5.

relations.subject: piece-b-king
relations.context: continues to b5.

relations.subject: player-white
relations.context: White brings another piece into the attack, moving the king's rook to d1.

relations.subject: piece-w-krook
relations.context: moving the king's rook to d1.

relations.subject: player-black
relations.context: Black's Queen tries to create some counterplay with a check on g4.

relations.subject: key_move-36
relations.context: with a check on g4.

relations.subject: player-white
relations.context: White simply blocks with the f-pawn.

relations.subject: piece-w-fpawn
relations.context: blocks with the f-pawn.

relations.subject: player-black
relations.context: The black Queen moves to f5.

relations.subject: piece-b-queen
relations.context: moves to f5.

relations.subject: player-white
relations.context: Another brutal knight check! The knight lands on d6.

relations.subject: key_move-39
relations.context: Another brutal knight check!

relations.subject: player-black
relations.context: The king is forced to retreat back to b6.

relations.subject: piece-b-king
relations.context: retreat back to b6.

relations.subject: player-white
relations.context: White's queen's bishop joins the party, delivering a check from e3.

relations.subject: key_move-41
relations.context: delivering a check from e3.

relations.subject: player-black
relations.context: The king has only one move, running to the edge of the board at a5.

relations.subject: piece-b-king
relations.context: running to the edge of the board at a5.

relations.subject: player-black
relations.context: A CATASTROPHIC BLUNDER FROM BLACK! Black has left the Queen on f5 completely undefended.

relations.subject: player-white
relations.context: White's knight on d6 simply leaps over and captures the black Queen!

relations.subject: key_move-43
relations.context: White's knight on d6 simply leaps over and captures the black Queen!

relations.subject: player-black
relations.context: In a desperate move, Black's e-pawn captures White's bishop on d5.

relations.subject: player-white
relations.context: White's Queen recaptures the pawn on d5, with check.

relations.subject: player-black
relations.context: Black blocks the check with the b-pawn.

relations.subject: player-white
relations.context: The white Queen gives another check from d2.

relations.subject: player-black
relations.context: Black's knight blocks on b4.

relations.subject: player-white
relations.context: White methodically pushes the a-pawn to a3, tightening the net.

relations.subject: player-black
relations.context: Black's bishop captures the heroic white knight that won the queen earlier.

relations.subject: player-white
relations.context: The white Queen immediately captures that knight on b4, with check.

relations.subject: player-black
relations.context: The king is forced to a6.

relations.subject: player-white
relations.context: The rook now delivers a check from d6.

relations.subject: player-black
relations.context: The king shuffles to b7.

relations.subject: player-white
relations.context: The Queen captures another pawn on b5, with check.

relations.subject: player-black
relations.context: The king moves to c7.

relations.subject: player-white
relations.context: Another check from the Queen on c6.

relations.subject: player-black
relations.context: The king is forced to b8.

relations.subject: player-white
relations.context: White's bishop moves to f4, a brilliant preparatory move, cutting off all escape squares.

relations.subject: player-black
relations.context: Black pushes the h-pawn, a completely futile move.

relations.subject: player-white
relations.context: CHECKMATE! The white rook slides to d8, delivering the final blow.

relations.subject: key_move-61
relations.context: CHECKMATE!

relations.subject: game-outcome-checkmate
relations.context: Winner: White
